title: Understanding 'Facts are Facts'
advice: Acknowledge that emotions are normal and focus on completing tasks regardless of feelings. Communicate with trusted individuals to gain perspective.
key_insights: Accepting negative feelings as facts reduces self-focus and promotes action. Overanalyzing often exacerbates distress.

title: Dealing with Neurotic Tendencies

context: trying to act solely to eliminate symptoms

advice: Instead of focusing on eliminating symptoms, follow inner desires to do meaningful tasks despite the symptoms.
key_insights: Shifting focus from eliminating symptoms to embracing actions reduces self-centeredness and aids recovery.

title: Handling Post-Exam Regret
advice: Avoid discussing symptoms with others as it increases self-awareness and distress. Redirect focus outward by engaging in daily tasks and connecting with others.
key_insights: Excessive self-focus amplifies distress. Engaging with external activities helps alleviate neurotic symptoms.

title: Balancing Self-Reflection and Action

context: difficulty moving on from past mistakes

advice: Reflect on areas for improvement without letting it hinder progress. Begin the next task while learning from past mistakes.
key_insights: Balancing reflection and forward momentum is key to overcoming neurotic tendencies.

title: Managing Overthinking and Free Time
advice: Engage in tasks to reduce overthinking but accept that random thoughts are normal. Practice moderation between activity and rest.
key_insights: Acknowledging overthinking as normal prevents it from becoming a source of distress. Moderation is essential for mental balance.

title: Recognizing Personal Limits
advice: Focus on achievable tasks and excel in them. Avoid forcing yourself into areas that exceed your abilities.
key_insights: Recognizing personal limits and focusing on strengths fosters sustainable progress.
